Articles.Content:

That should be it, hope it works!

Oh, now I see what I did wrong! Thanks, I'll try it out tomorrow!
Cool looking project! Thanks for making it!
Hey, new models and textures coming, thanks to MrTheBull!
ooooooooooooh! now with windows!

ooooooooooooh! now with windows!

Yeah, I'll be starting making IVA and airlock soon, after taking my theoretical physics exam tomorrow. :3
Landing gear in the future?

Landing gear in the future?

In a quite distant future, I have difficulties in making animations.
I tried this new part last night and it's extremely hard to control in an atmosphere. It keeps flipping nose over ass.
Nice but Windows at the front might be nice

I tried this new part last night and it's extremely hard to control in an atmosphere. It keeps flipping nose over ass.

Even when ditching Service Module?

Even when ditching Service Module?

I had built it to fly with some tiny jet engines, gear etc and take off from the runway. I did this to test if I could make it take off under its own power and be used as a scout plane for a Lathe mission. It took off fine but quickly started flipping upwards. I'm using the stock aerodynamics, no FAR or anything like that. I had made it as visually stable as I could in the SPH, but still it went all nutty as soon as I left the ground.

When I say "visually" I mean the CoM, CoThrust and Lift were all where they should be to make things stable.

I had built it to fly with some tiny jet engines, gear etc and take off from the runway. I did this to test if I could make it take off under its own power and be used as a scout plane for a Lathe mission. It took off fine but quickly started flipping upwards. I'm using the stock aerodynamics, no FAR or anything like that. I had made it as visually stable as I could in the SPH, but still it went all nutty as soon as I left the ground.

When I say "visually" I mean the CoM, CoThrust and Lift were all where they should be to make things stable.

I'll try to figure out how do i change the CoL of the model (I've already seen this is possible by checking stock models), so it's lifted. As an alternative, I'll do nose-heavy landing gears.

Hey, new models and textures coming, thanks to MrTheBull!

http://cs622730.vk.me/v622730511/2c/-lbf7P70omM.jpg

Much better
Guys, new release is coming in next 24 (or less) hours!
Cool, will the fairings work with bobcats Soyuz? Oh and any news on the iva?

Cool, will the fairings work with bobcats Soyuz? Oh and any news on the iva?

Actually, I have problems with the fairing collision mesh, so I guess they will be released a couple of days later. And I was planning compatibility with HGR's 1.875 rocket parts and standart 1.25 and 2.5 meters size. IVA is currently on hold, as I still haven't decided about its appearance and have problems with both university and job.

v0.15 ALPHA RELEASE!

Features:

  • New textures and models
  • Airlock
  • Extended Battery in the fuselage
  • More fuel in the SM
what is the weight of this little beauty? i think i will strap it on my Stock Soyuz

what is the weight of this little beauty? i think i will strap it on my Stock Soyuz

Wow, when I was checking I've noticed something strange in my SM config. Thanks! Its weight is about 5.5 tons. And I'll release a hotfix a couple of minutes away.

Edited August 31, 2014 by Niemand303
5.5 tons ... piece of cake fix it and i will lift it

5.5 tons ... piece of cake fix it and i will lift it

KerbalStuff already has a hotfix uploaded, but Curse upload is waiting for approval.
very nice!!!!!!

i'm afraid to say .. but it's very unstable to fly ... i can'T even get a lift off, after some seconds, the Kliper forces my Soyuz to nosedive ... emergency staging showedm that the klipper has serious lfit problems, way to much i think and balance is a serious problem on the Kliper itself.

i'm afraid to say .. but it's very unstable to fly ... i can'T even get a lift off, after some seconds, the Kliper forces my Soyuz to nosedive ... emergency staging showedm that the klipper has serious lfit problems, way to much i think and balance is a serious problem on the Kliper itself.

I always forget to mention that the fuselage spoiler should be turned off for take offs. I really need to make some kind of instructions.

Looking real nice with the airlock, now

I too can report a little trouble on landing, but It's pretty much golden for the whole of the flight before that
